For acute reactions occurring during or within 1 to 2 hours of an infusion

Mild Acute Reactions: -Sudden onset of flushing, dizziness, headache, rash, diaphoresis, nausea, palpitations but no respiratory or cardiovascular instability

Moderate Acute Reactions: -Any of the mild reaction symptoms WITH sudden onset of chest discomfort, shortness of breath, hypertension or hypotension i.e. a sudden 20 to 40 point change in SBP, increased temperature, hives

Severe Acute Reactions: -Involving 2 or more body systems including but not limited to cardiovascular instability with a SBP change of more than 40 points, rigors, shortness of breath, wheezing or stridor, angioedema, hives
For any acute reactions, stop and disconnect biologic agent infusion
Patient MUST stay 60 minutes for observation post infusion after reaction has been resolved
For severe acute reactions, CALL 911 Emergency Health Service AND notify provider on site or MD/Fellow on call
If medication is stopped and cannot be restarted then contact prescribing provider for further orders
